text: [Music]
hello everybody i'm diocinodinos
president of c4media creators of qcorn
and
and it's my pleasure to be talking today
to tejas chopra about his presentation
for qcon class november
thank you for being with us tejas
my pleasure
first voltages what is the focus of your
work these days
hi everyone
and
the focus of my work these days is
something called netflix drive
and that's the topic of presentation as
well
and just a brief background on it uh
netflix drive is is the paved path for
storing and retrieving and managing
tons of media assets that are generated
by netflix studios and streaming
platforms so you can think of it as
google drive
but on google drive ui files and folders
netflix drive is something that artists
and studios will use
for backing up their data
and globally distributing it in a
performant and scalable manner so that's
the focus of what i do right now and my
talk
and how would you describe the persona
and the level of the target audience
we intend netflix drive to be a generic
file system for storage
and so any software engineer
or architect that is you that is looking
to use a cloud and on-premise based uh
or cloud-based or on-premise based any
sort of a
end can use netflix drive we plan to
open source it soon so it is a framework
where different types of data stores and
metadata stores can be plugged in
and so you can imagine it can have s3
dynamodb mongodb or other types of
databases plugged in
so our target audience is any architect
that is working on any files file store
or asset store
you mentioned some of the more
traditional consumer cloud services for
storage what would be the main
difference between a netflix drive and
any of the other cloud services
sure
so when you use cloud services
the number one reason that you would
want to use something like netflix drive
is that you can configure netflix drive
using rest endpoints so it is not just a
file system it also has apis built into
it and for artists that work on images
or photos
they need to have the ability to
configure their workflows so you can
imagine let's say there's a big movie
that is being created and there are a
bunch of artists that are working on
different parts of the movie you want
these artists to only have access to the
paths that they care about and not the
entire corpus of data netflix drive can
enable that seamlessly with different
workflows
and pipelines that are done in netflix
studios today so that is what
differentiates it the other thing is
that security
and scalability and latency are things
that are first-class citizens in netflix
drive
so netflix drive intelligently places
the data on
on-premise local and cloud systems so
it's a hybrid system that can work in
conjunction with multiple backends
the other part is because it's a
framework we are exposing it to the
audience so that they can plug in any
sort of database or any sort of data
stored on the backend so there may be
folks that work with multiple cloud
providers folks that do not work with
cloud at all so they can still use the
benefits of netflix drive uh without
being tied to any cloud provider
and you mentioned something about
general availability open sourcing it
are there any plans for that i do plan
to do it uh pretty soon uh we are
working on our end to make it more
robust and then we would uh definitely
announce it we also have a blog post on
netflix drive on the netflix technology
blog where we talk more about the design
and our plans to open source it
and ted just finally what do you feel is
the most important trend in software
right now
oh uh i think that the world is
uh opening his eyes its eyes to a new
technology called the blockchain so i
feel that today when folks use cloud uh
cloud is still a form of centralized
storage that is owned by enterprises
i feel that the next trend would be
decentralized cloud where cloud would be
a combination of uh
services that are owned in a
decentralized manner without a single
enterprise owning it
backed by the blockchain so i i do
believe the world will move towards that
direction and the other thing i feel is
that non-fungible tokens will actually
come into play in our day-to-day lives
so today when you scroll on social media
you see photos images posts on linkedin
all of those would be actually backed by
nft tokens on the blockchain um and so
every content would have a backing
non-fungible token with it that's how i
think and that's
my feeling of how software would evolve
in the future
is there could there be any connection
between a data storage service like
netflix so that like netflix drive
and the blockchain do you guys have any
uh plans to integrate it
uh
no no no we we are uh we just go with
the traditional cloud providers at this
point but i feel that cloud in the
future would not be owned by enterprises
and so we would have to naturally evolve
to see how the future goes but in so far
as netflix drive is concerned right now
we are based on public clouds and their
interfaces that we have available today
